intro: Habracanthus cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas's habracanthus, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its distinctive morphology. The plant features palmate leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
